snippet: Albert Pujols, the high-paid slugger, did not have a home run in his first month with the Angels, his new team, who begin May with an 8-15 record.
abstract: Los Angeles Angels defeat Minnesota Twins, 4-3; Angels first baseman Albert Pujols, who did not hit a single home run in April, goes 1-for-4 with a double in the first inning. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. -- The echoing crack and the pale blur heading for the left-field seats were what the crowd had been waiting for. After it became airborne, it was as if everyone at Angel Stadium on Monday night was willing the ball over the wall, so one of baseball's most expensive and celebrated home run hitters could end the month of April with an exclamation point rather than a question mark.

headline.main: Angels Await First Sparks, and Blasts, From Pujols After a Barren April
